issue_description:
# Content is not aligned properly when an incorrect answer is given

**Describe the bug**
Content is not aligned properly when an incorrect answer is given

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Learn' - Basics of Addition
2. Click on 'Addition and Subtraction' - Click on Conitnue
3. For any question enter an incorrect answer
4. See the screen after the response

**Observed behavior**
Content is not aligned properly when an incorrect answer is given

**Expected behavior**
No. That's not correct and the content below it should be aligned properly

**Screenshots / Videos**
![Screenshot 2022-09-05 12 22 11 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/101634267/188389230-250a4100-b9df-4037-912c-4c08364bd1fe.png)


**Desktop (please complete the following information; delete this section if the issue does not arise on desktop):**
OS: Chrome
Browser: chrome
Browser-version: 104.0.5112.83

issue_comments.body: Margin-left was given implicitly to that paragraph in the rte-viewer. However, I have corrected it by removing that extra left margin.

> Margin-left was given implicitly to that paragraph in the rte-viewer. However, I have corrected it by removing that extra left margin.

@Shivkant-Chauhan Has this been completed?
No, other contributors can work on this. Can also refer to this closed PR: https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/16045

@9520prashant Please read the previous comments in the thread before working on an issue.

The previous PR attempt in https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/16045/files is actually correct, but needs some verification. Take a look at the PR comments to see what that verification is. If you (or another contributor) can post that proof that it works, we can assign this issue.

@seanlip sir I gone through the previous PR and at https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/16045/files  in 1741 line 
if we change magin-left:15px to margin-left:2px then it should align properly and I also checked that change for every device like for i-phone , samsung , etc. It will work for every devices. 

Please confirm it to see my screenshot/video and if it is okay then please assign this issue to me.

![Screenshot (132)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99237795/219597138-c2b32ada-9480-444f-9aec-23508ec7482d.png)
Please (a) do this testing on your local server, (b) read the reviewer's comment on the previous PR for what exactly is required.

@seanlip Sure sir , but i am new in community I need your little help please let me know the file structure means file name (Please) I have solved it in my brower

I am unable to find the file

OK, please ask on GitHub Discussions for help navigating the codebase. You may also find https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Find-the-right-code-to-change helpful to read, as well as the "Codebase Overview" page and its sub-pages in the wiki sidebar.

@seanlip Hello sir I think in https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/16045/files there are no need of margin-left:15px ,

without that the content will align properly
@9520prashant My response to you is still https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/15987#issuecomment-1434321304.
Hey @seanlip this issue can be labeled as `good first` issue. Thanks.
I agree that this seems to be fixed. Thanks for confirming @prafulbbandre!

text_context:
# Content is not aligned properly when an incorrect answer is given

**Describe the bug**
Content is not aligned properly when an incorrect answer is given

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Learn' - Basics of Addition
2. Click on 'Addition and Subtraction' - Click on Conitnue
3. For any question enter an incorrect answer
4. See the screen after the response

**Observed behavior**
Content is not aligned properly when an incorrect answer is given

**Expected behavior**
No. That's not correct and the content below it should be aligned properly

**Screenshots / Videos**
![Screenshot 2022-09-05 12 22 11 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/101634267/188389230-250a4100-b9df-4037-912c-4c08364bd1fe.png)


**Desktop (please complete the following information; delete this section if the issue does not arise on desktop):**
OS: Chrome
Browser: chrome
Browser-version: 104.0.5112.83



Margin-left was given implicitly to that paragraph in the rte-viewer. However, I have corrected it by removing that extra left margin.

> Margin-left was given implicitly to that paragraph in the rte-viewer. However, I have corrected it by removing that extra left margin.

@Shivkant-Chauhan Has this been completed?

No, other contributors can work on this. Can also refer to this closed PR: https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/16045

@KolliAnitha I figured out this issue. 

we have to give  in

.oppia.rte.viewers>p.first-child {
       margin-left: 2px;
}

then it should align properly . Please  assign me this issue.

@9520prashant Please read the previous comments in the thread before working on an issue.

The previous PR attempt in https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/16045/files is actually correct, but needs some verification. Take a look at the PR comments to see what that verification is. If you (or another contributor) can post that proof that it works, we can assign this issue.

@seanlip Ok Let me check

@seanlip sir I gone through the previous PR and at https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/16045/files  in 1741 line 
if we change magin-left:15px to margin-left:2px then it should align properly and I also checked that change for every device like for i-phone , samsung , etc. It will work for every devices. 

Please confirm it to see my screenshot/video and if it is okay then please assign this issue to me.

![Screenshot (132)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99237795/219597138-c2b32ada-9480-444f-9aec-23508ec7482d.png)


Please (a) do this testing on your local server, (b) read the reviewer's comment on the previous PR for what exactly is required.

@seanlip Sure sir , but i am new in community I need your little help please let me know the file structure means file name (Please) I have solved it in my brower

I am unable to find the file

OK, please ask on GitHub Discussions for help navigating the codebase. You may also find https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Find-the-right-code-to-change helpful to read, as well as the "Codebase Overview" page and its sub-pages in the wiki sidebar.

Thank you so much @seanlip sir

@seanlip Hello sir I think in https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/16045/files there are no need of margin-left:15px ,

without that the content will align properly


@9520prashant My response to you is still https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/15987#issuecomment-1434321304.

Hey @seanlip this issue can be labeled as `good first` issue. Thanks.

@seanlip I tried to reproduce the issue mention above and i dont see any problem at all.
Here is the screenshot for the following.

![Screenshot (56)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/109658545/231265161-f8622172-cdc3-43e4-bde3-f49dd546a690.png)


I agree that this seems to be fixed. Thanks for confirming @prafulbbandre!
questions_generated: What specific CSS modification is suggested to fix the alignment issue for incorrect answers in the oppia_oppia repository?
In which file is the CSS change for fixing the alignment issue likely to be made?
What steps are outlined to reproduce the alignment issue when an incorrect answer is given in the 'Learn' section?
How did the previous attempt (PR #16045) address the alignment issue, and what verification was requested?
What is the role of the .oppia.rte.viewers>p.first-child CSS selector in the context of this issue?
What additional steps should a contributor take if they are new to the oppia_oppia codebase and want to work on this issue?
golden_answers_generated: The suggested fix is to change the margin-left property from 15px to 2px for the paragraph inside .oppia.rte.viewers>p.first-child to align the content properly when an incorrect answer is given.
The CSS change to fix the alignment issue is likely to be made in the core/templates/css/oppia.css file, where other styling rules for the oppia application are defined.

To reproduce the issue: 1) Go to 'Learn' - Basics of Addition, 2) Click on 'Addition and Subtraction' - Click on Continue, 3) Enter an incorrect answer for any question, 4) Observe the screen after the response to see the misalignment.

The previous attempt in PR #16045 proposed changing the margin-left property to address the alignment issue. The requested verification involved testing the change on various devices and posting proof (e.g., screenshots or videos) to confirm it works as intended across different platforms.

The .oppia.rte.viewers>p.first-child CSS selector targets the first paragraph element within the rte-viewer class. Adjusting its margin-left property is intended to correct the alignment of content when an incorrect answer is given, ensuring consistent visual presentation.

A new contributor should ask for help navigating the codebase on GitHub Discussions or refer to the project's documentation. They should also ensure they understand the file structure and familiarize themselves with relevant CSS and HTML files to effectively implement and test their changes locally.
